intro: Sessea sodiroi, commonly known as the African violet, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often with thick, fleshy leaves that store water. Its roots are fibrous and adapted to thrive in well-drained, sandy soils. Sessea sodiroi is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
